Description: Two joining rim fragments of a glazed composition bowl; mould-made; light reddish brown core; thin walled; only a tiny trace of greenish blue glaze preserved; traces of linear decoration in black paint; framed band of horizontal running lozenges at rim interior; traces of head and tail or wing of a bird below, possibly a duck.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No.190)
